title.narrative: FUAD Winter Response 2015 for IDPs in Kirkurk Province

description.narrative: Kirkurk province, being located on the state border between Federal Iraq and KRG has become the home to many IDPs seeking solace from the conflict that continues in Federal Iraq. This project is therefore well placed to serve the humanitarian needs of particularly vulnerable IDPs that have fled violence and reached Kirkurk. The immediate relief provided by FUAD in this programme provides them with sufficient basic winter NFI items to ensure that their basic physical protection needs from the harsh winter elements are met for a month to help them avoid negative coping strategies (including prostitution, crime, and excessive borrowing), and affording some level of dignity to families in desperate need of relief items.

The overall goal is to alleviate suffering through immediate relief assistance to targeted IDP households (300 of the most Vulnerable IDPs living in unfinished buildings, widows, families with disabled members, families with large numbers of females, large families that have more than 6 members) through provision of winterisation kits containing: 6 Blankets, One Heater Kerosene (or Electric - assessment dependent), plastic sheet (20 m2), 5 jerry cans (of 20 litres of Kerosene) and 25 meters of rope to string up the plastic sheeting.
Christian Aid's local consultant will coordinate CA’s partners’ programmes on the ground and will also support partners to ensure there is coordination with other actors in the broader emergency response programmes being implemented by other agencies.
